benchmark_details.name: AfriSenti-SemEval
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a benchmark for sentiment analysis across 12 African languages using the AfriSenti-SemEval Shared Task 12 dataset, which includes annotated data collected from Twitter for sentiment classification.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark and evaluate the performance of current state-of-the-art transformer models for sentiment analysis across multiple African languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: More data would improve performance across the board, and the reliance on pre-existing models carries limitations and potential bias.

data.source: Twitter datasets from the AfriSenti-SemEval Shared Task 12.
data.annotation: Manually annotated sentiment labels for positive, negative, and neutral sentiments.

methodology.calculation: Standard, weighted average classification metrics were used to evaluate model performance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher weighted average metrics indicate better model performance on sentiment classification tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: XLM-R was used as a baseline model for comparison.
methodology.validation: The evaluation utilized held-out validation sets and multiple seeds to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for misuse includes mass surveillance and suppression of free speech.
